features.description: User can submit a question and receive parallel responses from multiple LLMs (Stage 1)
steps: Enter a question in the input composer
Submit the question
View individual model responses in tabbed interface
Verify all configured council models responded
features.notes: Core Stage 1 functionality - parallel queries via OpenRouter API

features.description: User can view anonymized peer rankings from each model (Stage 2)
steps: After Stage 1 completes, Stage 2 automatically runs
Each model receives anonymized responses (Response A, B, C...)
View each model's evaluation and ranking in tabs
Verify parsed rankings are extracted correctly
View aggregate rankings showing average position
features.notes: Anonymization prevents models from playing favorites

features.description: User can view the chairman's synthesized final answer (Stage 3)
steps: After Stage 2 completes, chairman synthesizes final answer
View final answer with green-tinted background
Verify synthesis incorporates rankings and responses

features.description: User can create, view, and switch between multiple conversations
steps: Create a new conversation
Submit questions to build conversation history
Switch to a different conversation
Verify previous conversation is preserved
Return to original conversation and verify history
features.notes: Conversations stored as JSON in data/conversations/

features.description: User can configure council models dynamically via UI
steps: Access council configuration panel
Add or remove models from the council
Change the chairman model
Submit a question and verify new configuration is used
Verify configuration persists across page refreshes

features.description: User can view markdown-formatted responses with proper rendering
steps: Submit a question that would generate markdown (code, lists, etc.)
Verify code blocks render with syntax highlighting
Verify lists, headers, and other markdown elements render correctly
features.notes: Uses ReactMarkdown with markdown-content class for styling

features.description: System gracefully handles individual model failures without failing entire request
steps: Configure a council with an invalid/unavailable model
Submit a question
Verify successful responses are still displayed
Verify failed model is indicated but doesn't crash the app
features.notes: Graceful degradation - continues with successful responses

features.description: User can validate ranking parsing by viewing raw evaluation and extracted ranking
steps: Complete a deliberation through Stage 2
View a model's evaluation tab
Verify raw evaluation text is visible
Verify 'Extracted Ranking' section shows parsed results
Compare raw text FINAL RANKING section with parsed output
features.notes: Transparency feature - users can validate system's interpretation
